alert.note: Alert for Calaveras; Tuolumne (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 11 at 2:59PM PST until March 11 at 3:15PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM PST FOR SOUTHWESTERN TUOLUMNE AND SOUTHEASTERN CALAVERAS COUNTIES... At 255 PM PST, a storm capable of producing a tornado was located over Jamestown and moving into Sonora, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement has received 3 reports of funnel clouds near Jamestown. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Tuolumne and southeastern Calaveras Counties, including the following locations... Mono Vista, Phoenix Lake-Cedar, Columbia, Jamestown, Groveland-Big Oak, Phoenix Lake-Cedar Ridge, East Sonora, Twain Harte, Tuolumne City and Soulsbyville. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: Funnel clouds have been reported. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
